comments:
I am trying to connect to DB2 universal v8.1 using the universal driver. It
always fails when I try to actually create a data set. 

Here are my steps:

1. Installed BIRT on Eclipse v3.1 or v3.2 (happens with both)
2. Create new workspace, new report project and report
3. Switch to "Data explorer"
4. Right-click Data source -> New Data Source
5. Select JDBC Data Source and click next
6. Click "Manage drivers
7. Add
   db2jcc.jar
   db2_license_cu.jar
   db2_jcc_license_cisuz.jar
8. Click OK
9. Select com.ibm.db2.jcc.DB2Driver (v2.2)
10. Enter my db2 URL
    something like: "jdbc:db2://db2host:50000/SAMPLE"
11. Enter username/password
12. Click "Test Connection", I get a successful test connection
13. Click Finish
14. Right-click Data sets -> New Data Set
15. Click Finish

"An error has occure. See the log for more details"


.log

There are a bunch of other NullPointerExceptions, but this one looks most
relevant. I'll attach the entire log so you can see the other NPEs.

The data set dialog still comes up, if I select "Query" or "Preview results"
then I get similar errors.

Created an attachment (id=27476)
.log file from my workspace

I cannot reproduce this bug in my environment. However, I guess this bug may 
related to the installation problem of DB2.Please refer to Bugzilla Bug 109981 
No table in db2 but return a error.  for more detaied info.
This bug has been verified in build 20051013
